intro: Pimpinella saxifraga subsp. saxifraga, commonly known as the rock parsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. This subspecies is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
